author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector A. Gnanasekaran (centre) checks an Electronic Voting Machine soon after the launch of the First Level Checking drive in Tiruvannamalai on Wednesday.— Photo: Special Arrangement

The First Level Checking (FLC) of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) began in Tiruvannamalai Collectorate on Wednesday in view of the forthcoming assembly election.

There are 5,678 ballot units and 4,186 control units stored in the Tiruvannamalai Collectorate. Fitness of each and every machine is to be checked before an election.

The FLC drive began in the presence of Collector A. Gnanasekaran, District Revenue Officer S. Palani and Revenue Divisional Officer R. Uma Maheswari.

Five-member team from Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) came to Tiruvannamalai to carry out the check. Each and every machine would be switched on and every button available in these machines would be pressed and verified for correctness in the FLC drive. It may take a week to ten days to complete the drive, sources said.
title: Checking of EVMs begins in Tiruvannamalai
